channel.title: Moparcraft Mumble server
channel.description:
I'd like to promote the usage of the Moparcraft mumble server more, I've been holding back on doing this because I've not been using it myself because I simply didn't have a microphone so now that I bought a relatively cheap one and can actually join in I'd like to use it for multiple things, mainly just some community discussion at the moment:
[b]Connection information[/b]
IP:mumble.moparcraft.net Port:64738 Download:http://mumble.sourceforge.net/
I would also appreciate some opinions on whether you guys would prefer mumble or ventrillo, I was discussing this idea with Taharok and hopefully we can make some use of these voice servers.

item.title: Moparcraft Mumble server
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“RiotScape1337, post:4, topic:448497”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=551395.msg4041507#msg4041507 date=1341688685]
Mumble is far better than either teamspeak or ventrillo, and since minecraft is cross-platform and out of the chat clients, mumble is the only one that is also cross-platform, it seems an obvious choice as to which one to stick with.

Also, that’s the default mumble port, so you don’t have to supply it if you don’t want to.
[/quote]
What makes it so much better than teamspeak or vent?[/quote]

That has many answers, one is what Travas said above, here are some of the others:
http://mumble.sourceforge.net/FAQ#What_is_Mumble.3F
http://mumble.sourceforge.net/FAQ#What_makes_Mumble_better.3F
http://mumble.sourceforge.net/FAQ#Is_Mumble_encrypted.3F
http://mumble.sourceforge.net/FAQ#Why_does_Mumble_sound_so_much_better_than_other_voice_products.3F

Read full topic

item.title: Moparcraft Mumble server
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“RiotScape1337, post:4, topic:448497”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=551395.msg4041507#msg4041507 date=1341688685]
Mumble is far better than either teamspeak or ventrillo, and since minecraft is cross-platform and out of the chat clients, mumble is the only one that is also cross-platform, it seems an obvious choice as to which one to stick with.

Also, that’s the default mumble port, so you don’t have to supply it if you don’t want to.
[/quote]
What makes it so much better than teamspeak or vent?[/quote]Well one of the reasons is that it is cross platform. Any user can use it on any type of operating system.

Read full topic
